media:group.media:description:
üìçThe credit rating agency Fitch declined to lower Armenia‚Äôs sovereign credit rating following Azerbaijan‚Äôs lightning offensive against Nagorno-Karabakh last month. üìç‚ÄòThe Armenian economy‚Äôs growth rates will remain high until the end of the year,‚Äô the Eurasian Development Bank forecast in its latest regional macroeconomic report. üìçArmenia has approached Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates with a proposal to invest in a planned industrial park and special economic zone in the city of Gyumri.

entry.title: Brussels to Baku: Recognize Armenia‚Äôs Territorial Integrity

media:group.media:title: Brussels to Baku: Recognize Armenia‚Äôs Territorial Integrity
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe European Union called on Azerbaijan to ensure the return of Nagorno-Karabakh‚Äôs Armenians to their homes and recognize Armenia‚Äôs territorial integrity. üìçAbout 3,000 people forcibly displaced from their homes in Nagorno-Karabakh have already left Armenia for other countries, mainly Russia. üìçThe Armenian government will relocate the planned ‚Äúacademic city‚Äù project from the town of Ashtarak to Yerevan.

entry.title: Stabbed In The Front: Russia‚Äôs Betrayal of Armenia

media:group.media:title: Stabbed In The Front: Russia‚Äôs Betrayal of Armenia
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet host and commentator Patrick Elliott sits down with political analyst and former parliamentarian Mikayel Zolyan to discuss Armenian- Russian relations.
They cover prime minister Pashinyan‚Äôs consequential speech at the European Parliament in Strasbourg, in which he openly declares Armenia‚Äôs desire to partner with the EU as closely as possible.
They also touch on possible scenarios for retaliation that Russia might concoct to punish Armenia, and what decoupling could look like.
